metadata.title: CVE-2020-3327 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in the ARJ archive parsing module in Clam AntiVirus(ClamAV) Software versions 0.102.2 could allow an unauthenticated, remoteattacker to cause a denial of service condition on an affected device. Thevulnerability is due to a heap buffer overflow read. An attacker couldexploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted ARJ file to an affecteddevice. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause the ClamAV scanningprocess crash, resulting in a denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-3327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
clamav-base - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
clamav-daemon - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
clamav-freshclam - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
clamav-milter - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
clamav-testfiles - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
libclamav9 - 0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.102.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1').
